moves.1. Nf3: Training game. The comments with the players' names in brackets were made during the game.
(brulla) Now the typical King's Indian Attack-development is finished and the middle game is about to start.
moves.7... O-O:
(easy19) Looking at this position the plan must be simple
Concidering i wil do the 0-0 in the next few moves
And most of your pieces already directed onto mij kings wing. it is good to concentrate on the e4 e5 and f4 f5 squares with as ultimate goal launching an attack on my kings wing.
moves.8. exd5 Nxd5 9. c3 Be6 10. Qe2 Qc7 11. N: brulla: In the post mortem analysis, this seems risky and together with white's next move thebase for black's mate attack. Something more solid and developing seems better: 17.Rd1
moves.17... Nxe5 18. Bxa8: brulla: This takes away an active piece of white for a passive piece of black. Tempting, but not good.
moves.18... Rxa8:
(easy19) I like to maintain some mobility on the board..
I think i have got that now.. and after the exchange i can build op pretty good pressure on your kings position.. or depending on your moves go for a nasty queen hunt...

opening: Reti (A08), King's Indian attack, French variation
